alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Crockett; Gibson; Madison (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 6:20PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following counties, Carroll, Crockett, Gibson and Madison. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 620 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackson, Humboldt, Milan, Huntingdon, Fairview, Alamo, Bells, Three Way, Bruceton, Atwood, Adair, Carroll, Medina, Trezevant, Hollow Rock, Gadsden, Gibson, McLemoresville, Lavinia and Whitthorne. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
